channel.title: Notes on Staying up later than I should
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Staying up later than I should

item.title: Where Are My GitHub Pages?
item.description: This site runs on GitHub Pages, and although it’s a great feature, it was a little confusing to figure out where things needed to be at first. There are a few different kinds of GitHub Pages: GitHub Pages for a GitHub user GitHub Pages for a GitHub organization GitHub Pages for a specific repo GitHub Pages for a GitHub User or Organization Consider this the main “site” for an account. The GitHub Pages for the account (or organization) is an overall “general” site that is not specific to a given repository.

item.title: Go head, tailor your tools
item.description: I recently heard someone else share their perspective that one should not customize their tools. I also fell into this camp, until pretty recently. The lesson of vi I made what I believed was a wise choice back in the 90s when I was first getting comfortable in unix (AIX at the time). I decided to eschew other options and learn and stick with vi, at least for editing system configuration files.
